item.title: ERM: Empirical Risk Minimization
item.description: Empirical risk $R$ is a measurement the goodness of fit based on empirical information. Empirical risk minimization minimizes the empirical risk to select a good model $\hat f$ out of all possible models $f$ in our hypothesis space for a dataset $\mathcal D$, $$ \hat f = \operatorname{argmin} R(f, \mathcal D). $$ Empirical Risk Example For example, the emprical risk can be represented by the negative log likelihood. A negative log likelihood (NLL) for a model $\theta$ of dataset $\mathcal D$
